title: Easily Shorten Videos on a Samsung Android Phone

steps.title: Open the Gallery on your Samsung Galaxy.
steps.content: Open the Gallery on your Samsung Galaxy. It's the red icon with a white flower inside on the latest models, and a white icon with a multicolored flower on older models. You'll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the video you want to trim.
steps.content: Tap the video you want to trim. The video will open and begin to play. If you're using a Samsung Galaxy S20, you can join multiple videos clips into a single movie before editing. Just open the first video, tap the film icon at the top, select additional video clips, and then tap Create Movie . When you're ready to trim the new movie, tap Edit Yourself to launch the editor. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the video editor.
steps.content: Open the video editor. You can do this by tapping the pencil icon or the word Edit at the bottom of the video. [3] X Research source If you don't see either of these options, tap the three dots at the top-right corner of the video and select Editor instead.

steps.title: Drag the left slider to the place where the video should start.
steps.content: Drag the left slider to the place where the video should start.

steps.title: Drag the right slider to the place where the video should end.
steps.content: Drag the right slider to the place where the video should end. The parts of the video outside the selected area will darken.

steps.title: Tap the play button to see a preview.
steps.content: Tap the play button to see a preview. It's the sideways triangle at the bottom-left corner of the video preview. Depending on your model, you may have to tap Trim or a checkmark before you can preview the video. If you don't like the results, readjust the sliders until you're happy with the video.

steps.title: Tap SAVE when you're finished.
steps.content: Tap SAVE when you're finished. It's at the top-right corner of the screen. This saves the trimmed video to your Gallery. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the gallery.
steps.content: Open the gallery. Tap the red icon with the flower inside it. With an S25 series phone, you can utilize AI to generate a highlight clip that includes scenes from multiple videos to share an event with others. This is very helpful if you have multiple videos of something that you want to condense into a quick video (like if you want to show off multiple videos of your cruise in a single video).

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . You'll see this three-line menu icon in the bottom right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Go to Studio.
steps.content: Tap Go to Studio . It's at the bottom of the menu next to a red icon.

steps.title: Tap Start new project.
steps.content: Tap Start new project . You'll see this at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Select photos and videos to add.
steps.content: Select photos and videos to add. You can also search "Albums" at the bottom to see the different collections of photos and videos you have. You can also "search" for specific images and select to see only videos. Tap to select the photos or videos. You'll see a checkmark appear in the top left corner of the thumbnail when you select it. Tap Done when you're ready to continue.

steps.title: Tap the AI trim feature.
steps.content: Tap the AI trim feature. It looks like a circle around a pair of scissors in the lower left corner of your screen. AI will extract key scenes from the videos you selected to make a single video.

steps.title: Select a version length.
steps.content: Select a version length. You have the ability to choose between a short and long version of the video. Select one and press the play icon to see a preview of it. Tap the slider icon next to "Short" and "Long" to manually adjust how long you want the video to be. You can tap the thumbnails under the preview to see where each clip is inside the main video and adjust them the same way.

steps.title: Tap Apply.
steps.content: Tap Apply . It's in the lower right corner and will open another editor so you can make more changes.

steps.title: Drag and drop videos to change the sequence (optional).
steps.content: Drag and drop videos to change the sequence (optional). If one clip in the video makes more sense to be before the other clip, you can drag and drop it from the timeline.

steps.title: Personalize it.
steps.content: Personalize it. Use the icons at the bottom to add text, stickers, and more to your video. Tap the smiley face icon to add stickers. You can then drag the slider below the timeline to change how long the sticker stays on the video. Drag and drop the sticker to move it around the screen, and pinch and pull your fingers to make it bigger or smaller. Tap the < arrow to navigate back. Tap the "T" icon to add text, then set the font, size, and color. Tap Apply to add it to the video, and drag the slider to change when the text appears over the video. Tap the < arrow to navigate back. Tap the brush with the line icon to draw on the video. Tap the < arrow to navigate back. Tap the music note to add music to your video. You can adjust when each element appears on the video by adjusting the icon below the timeline.

steps.title: Preview your video.
steps.content: Preview your video. Press the "Play" icon below the preview to see it in action, along with all of your additions, like text, stickers, and music.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's in the top right corner and will finalize your video creation. You can tap Share movie to share it with others or Delete to get rid of it. [5] X Research source Give your movie a name by tapping the default "Movie" name and entering a new one!
